title: SEO Blog Post Writer
description: SEO Blog Post Writer prompt that creates engaging, Google-optimized articles that rank on page 1 and drive organic traffic to your website.
prompt:
You are an expert SEO content writer who has written blog posts generating millions of organic visits monthly. Create a comprehensive, SEO-optimized blog post that will rank on Google's first page.

CONTENT REQUIREMENTS:
- Primary Keyword: [YOUR MAIN KEYWORD]
- Secondary Keywords: [2-3 RELATED KEYWORDS]
- Search Intent: [Informational/Commercial/Transactional/Navigational]
- Target Audience: [DESCRIBE YOUR READER]
- Competitor URLs to Beat: [TOP 3 RANKING ARTICLES]
- Word Count Target: [1500-3000 words typically]
- Brand Voice: [Professional/Casual/Friendly/Authoritative]

Create a complete blog post including:

1. SEO-OPTIMIZED TITLE OPTIONS
Provide 5 title variations:
- Title with power word + number
- Question-based title
- How-to title format
- Benefit-driven title
- Curiosity gap title

Each title should:
- Include primary keyword naturally
- Be under 60 characters
- Have emotional trigger
- Promise clear value
- Stand out in SERPs

2. META DESCRIPTION
Write a compelling 150-160 character meta description that:
- Includes primary keyword
- Creates urgency or curiosity
- Has clear call-to-action
- Mentions key benefit
- Uses active voice

3. INTRODUCTION (150-200 words)
Hook Types to Use:
- Shocking statistic
- Relatable problem
- Provocative question
- Story or anecdote
- Contrarian statement

Structure:
- Hook (first 1-2 sentences)
- Problem identification
- Solution preview
- Article roadmap
- Credibility statement

4. MAIN CONTENT STRUCTURE

Section 1: [Foundation/Background]
- H2 heading with keyword variation
- 2-3 H3 subheadings
- 300-400 words
- Include statistics/data
- Add expert quotes
- Use bullet points for scannability

Section 2: [Core Content/Deep Dive]
- H2 heading with LSI keyword
- 3-4 H3 subheadings
- 400-500 words
- Step-by-step process
- Real examples/case studies
- Visual content suggestions

Section 3: [Advanced Tips/Strategies]
- H2 heading with long-tail keyword
- 2-3 H3 subheadings
- 300-400 words
- Pro tips and secrets
- Common mistakes to avoid
- Tools and resources

Section 4: [Practical Application]
- H2 heading focused on action
- 2-3 H3 subheadings
- 300-400 words
- Implementation guide
- Templates or checklists
- Success metrics

Section 5: [FAQs]
- H2 "Frequently Asked Questions"
- 5-7 relevant questions
- 50-100 words per answer
- Schema markup ready
- Voice search optimized

5. SEO OPTIMIZATION ELEMENTS

Keyword Placement:
- Primary keyword in first 100 words
- In 30% of H2 headings
- 1-2% keyword density
- Natural variations throughout
- In image alt text
- In URL slug

LSI Keywords to Include:
[Generate 10-15 semantically related terms]

Internal Linking:
- Link to 3-5 related posts
- Use descriptive anchor text
- Link to pillar content
- Include category pages

External Linking:
- 2-3 authoritative sources
- Recent statistics/studies
- Government/edu sites preferred
- Open in new tabs

6. CONTENT FORMATTING

Readability Optimization:
- Sentences under 20 words (mostly)
- Paragraphs 2-3 sentences max
- Flesch Reading Score 60-70
- Active voice 80%+
- Transition words 30%+

Visual Elements to Include:
- Featured image description
- 3-5 supporting images
- Infographic opportunity
- Video embed suggestion
- Charts/graphs needed

Formatting Elements:
- Numbered lists
- Bullet points
- Bold key phrases
- Blockquotes for emphasis
- Tables for comparisons
- Callout boxes for tips

7. USER ENGAGEMENT ELEMENTS

Content Upgrades:
- Downloadable checklist
- PDF guide version
- Email course offer
- Template/worksheet
- Video tutorial

Interactive Elements:
- Quiz or assessment
- Calculator/tool
- Comments question
- Poll or survey
- Social share prompts

Trust Signals:
- Author bio
- Publish/update dates
- Sources cited
- Social proof
- Case study results

8. CONCLUSION (150-200 words)
- Summarize key points
- Reinforce main benefit
- Call-to-action (clear and specific)
- Next steps for reader
- Related content suggestions

9. SCHEMA MARKUP SUGGESTIONS
- Article schema
- FAQ schema
- How-to schema (if applicable)
- Author schema
- Breadcrumb schema

10. CONTENT DISTRIBUTION PLAN

Social Media Snippets:
- Twitter thread (5-7 tweets)
- LinkedIn post
- Facebook teaser
- Instagram carousel ideas
- Pinterest description

Email Newsletter Teaser:
- Subject line
- Preview text
- Email excerpt (150 words)

11. PERFORMANCE TRACKING

KPIs to Monitor:
- Organic traffic growth
- Average time on page
- Bounce rate
- Social shares
- Comment engagement
- Conversion rate
- SERP position tracking

Content Update Schedule:
- 30-day performance review
- 90-day optimization
- Annual refresh plan

12. COMPETITOR GAP ANALYSIS

What Competitors Miss:
- Identify content gaps
- Unique angles to cover
- Better examples to use
- More recent data
- Superior formatting
- Additional resources

Write the complete blog post following this structure. Make it comprehensive, engaging, and valuable enough that readers bookmark and share it. Use natural language that doesn't feel AI-generated. Include specific examples, data, and actionable advice throughout.
